Brief description: 11338 images of 1199 individuals in different positions and at different times.
Creator: United States Department of Defense

Dataset name: Ryerson Audio-Visual Database of Emotional Speech and Song (RAVDESS)
Brief description: 7.356 video and audio recordings of 24 professional actors. 8 emotions each at two intensities.
Preprocessing: Files labelled with expression. Perceptual validation ratings provided by 319 raters.
Creator: S.R. Livingstone and F.A. Russo

Brief description: Color images of faces at various angles.
Preprocessing: Location of facial features extracted. Coordinates of features given.
Creator: M. Grgic et al.

Brief description: Faces of 15 individuals in 11 different expressions.
Creator: J. Yang et al.

Brief description: Large database of images with labels for expressions.
Creator: T. Kanade et al.

Brief description: 213 images of 7 facial expressions (6 basic facial expressions + 1 neutral) posed by 10 Japanese female models.
Preprocessing: Images are cropped to the facial region. Includes semantic ratings data on emotion labels.
Creator: Lyons  Kamachi  Gyoba

Brief description: Images of public figures scrubbed from image searching.
Creator: H. Ng et al.

Brief description: Images of faces with eye positions marked.
Creator: BioID

Brief description: Randomly sampled color values from face images.
Creator: R. Bhatt.

Brief description: 3D Face image database.
Preprocessing: 34 action units and 6 expressions labeled; 24 facial landmarks labeled.
Creator: A Savran et al.

Brief description: neutral face  5 expressions: anger  happiness  sadness  eyes closed  eyebrows raised.
Creator: University of York

Brief description: Expressions: Anger  smile  laugh  surprise  closed eyes.
Creator: Institute of Automation  Chinese Academy of Sciences

Brief description: Expressions: Anger Disgust Fear Happiness Sadness Surprise
Format: Annotated Visible Spectrum and Near Infrared Video captures at 25 frames per second
Creator: Zhao  G. et al.

Brief description: neutral face  and 6 expressions: anger  happiness  sadness  surprise  disgust  fear (4 levels). 3D images extracted.

Brief description: Up to 22 samples for each subject. Expressions: anger  happiness  sadness  surprise  disgust  puffy. 3D Data.
Creator: National Institute of Standards and Technology

Brief description: Up to 61 samples for each subject. Expressions neutral face  smile  frontal accentuated laugh  frontal random gesture. 3D images.
Creator: King Juan Carlos University

Brief description: Up to 100 subjects  expressions mostly neutral. Several poses as well.
Creator: Royal Military Academy (Belgium)

Brief description: 112 persons (66 males and 46 females) wear glasses under different illumination conditions.
Preprocessing: A set of synthetic filters (blur  occlusions  noise  and posterization ) with different level of difficulty.
Default task: Gender classification  face detection  face recognition  age estimation  and glasses detection
Creator: Afifi  M. et al.

Brief description: IMDB and Wikipedia face images with gender and age labels.
Default task: Gender classification  face detection  face recognition  age estimation
Creator: R. Rothe  R. Timofte  L. V. Gool

Brief description: Brief description
Creator: Creator

Brief description: Videos from 20 different TV shows for prediction social actions: handshake  high five  hug  kiss and none.
Creator: Patron-Perez  A. et al.

Brief description: Recordings of a single person performing 12 actions
Format: 8 PhaseSpace Motion Capture  2 Stereo Cameras  4 Quad Cameras  6 accelerometers  4 microphones
Creator: Ofli  F. et al.

Brief description: Large video dataset for action classification.
Creator: Y. Jiang et al.

Brief description: Video dataset for action localization and spotting
Creator: Stoian et al.

Brief description: Brief description
Creator: Creator

Brief description: Images and their description
Creator: R. Krishna et al.

Brief description: 849 images taken in 75 different scenes. About 50 different object classes are labeled.
Creator: A. Janoch et al.

Dataset name: Berkeley Segmentation Data Set and Benchmarks 500 (BSDS500)
Brief description: 500 natural images  explicitly separated into disjoint train  validation and test subsets + benchmarking code. Based on BSDS300.
Preprocessing: Each image segmented by five different subjects on average.
Default task: Contour detection and hierarchical image segmentation
Creator: University of California  Berkeley

Brief description: complex everyday scenes of common objects in their natural context.
Preprocessing: Object highlighting  labeling  and classification into 91 object types.
Creator: T. Lin et al.

Brief description: Very large scene and object recognition database.
Preprocessing: Places and objects are labeled. Objects are segmented.
Creator: J. Xiao et al.

Brief description: Labeled object image database  used in the ImageNet Large Scale Visual Recognition Challenge
Preprocessing: Labeled objects  bounding boxes  descriptive words  SIFT features
Creator: J. Deng et al.

Brief description: A Large set of images listed as having CC BY 2.0 license with image-level labels and bounding boxes spanning thousands of classes.
Creator: [empty]

Dataset name: TV News Channel Commercial Detection Dataset
Brief description: TV commercials and news broadcasts.
Preprocessing: Audio and video features extracted from still images.
Creator: P. Guha et al.

Brief description: The instances were drawn randomly from a database of 7 outdoor images and hand-segmented to create a classification for every pixel.
Creator: University of Massachusetts

Brief description: Pictures of objects.
Creator: F. Li et al.

Brief description: Large dataset of images for object classification.
Creator: G. Griffin et al.

Brief description: SIFT features of Caltech-256 dataset.
Creator: X. Fu et al.

Brief description: Annotated pictures of scenes.
Creator: MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory

Brief description: Stereo video sequences recorded in street scenes  with pixel-level annotations. Metadata also included.
Creator: Daimler AG et al.

Brief description: Large number of images for classification tasks.
Creator: M. Everingham et al.

Brief description: Many small  low-resolution  images of 10 classes of objects.
Preprocessing: Classes labelled  training set splits created.
Creator: A. Krizhevsky et al.

Brief description: Like CIFAR-10  above  but 100 classes of objects are given.
Preprocessing: Classes labelled  training set splits created.
Creator: A. Krizhevsky et al.

Brief description: A unified contribution of CIFAR-10 and Imagenet with 10 classes  and 3 splits. Larger than CIFAR-10.
Preprocessing: Classes labelled  training  validation  test set splits created.
Creator: Luke N. Darlow  Elliot J. Crowley  Antreas Antoniou  Amos J. Storkey

Brief description: A MNIST-like fashion product database
Preprocessing: Classes labelled  training set splits created.
Creator: Zalando SE

Brief description: Some publicly available fonts and extracted glyphs from them to make a dataset similar to MNIST. There are 10 classes  with letters A-J taken from different fonts.
Preprocessing: Classes labelled  training set splits created.
Creator: Yaroslav Bulatov

Dataset name: German Traffic Sign Detection Benchmark Dataset
Brief description: Images from vehicles of traffic signs on German roads. These signs comply with UN standards and therefore are the same as in other countries.
Creator: S Houben et al.

Brief description: Autonomous vehicles driving through a mid-size city captured images of various areas using cameras and laser scanners.
Creator: A Geiger et al.

Brief description: Images of 5 classes of objects.
Preprocessing: Classes labelled  training set splits created.
Creator: Chaladze & Kalatozishvili

Brief description: Multi-modal dataset for obstacle detection in agriculture including stereo camera  thermal camera  web camera  360-degree camera  lidar  radar  and precise localization.
Creator: M. Kragh et al.

Brief description: 11.076 hand images (1600 x 1200 pixels) of 190 subjects  of varying ages between 18  75 years old  for gender recognition and biometric identification.
Creator: M Afifi

Brief description: Specifically designed for Continuous/Lifelong Learning and Object Recognition  is a collection of more than 500 videos (30fps) of 50 domestic objects belonging to 10 different categories.
Preprocessing: Classes labelled  training set splits created based on a 3-way  multi-runs benchmark.
Creator: V. Lomonaco and D. Maltoni

Dataset name: THz and thermal video data set
Brief description: This multispectral data set includes terahertz  thermal  visual  near infrared  and three-dimensional videos of objects hidden under people's clothes.
Preprocessing: 3D lookup tables are provided that allow you to project images onto 3D point clouds.
Instances: More than 20 videos. The duration of each video is about 85 seconds (about 345 frames).
Creator: Alexei A. Morozov and Olga S. Sushkova

Brief description: Brief description
Creator: Creator

Brief description: Artificially generated data describing the structure of 10 capital English letters.
Preprocessing: Coordinates of lines drawn given as integers. Various other features.

Brief description: Upper case printed letters.
Preprocessing: 17 features are extracted from all images.
Creator: D. Slate et al.

Brief description: Labeled samples of pen tip trajectories for people writing simple characters.
Preprocessing: 3-dimensional pen tip velocity trajectory matrix for each sample
Creator: B. Williams

Brief description: Character recognition in natural images of symbols used in both English and Kannada
Default task: Character recognition  handwriting recognition  OCR  classification
Creator: T. de Campos

Brief description: Isolated handwritten characters
Preprocessing: Coordinates of pen position as characters were written given.
Creator: F. Prat et al.

Brief description: Handwriting samples from the often-confused 4 and 9 characters.
Preprocessing: Features extracted from images  split into train/test  handwriting images size-normalized.
Creator: Yann LeCun et al.

Brief description: 1623 different handwritten characters from 50 different alphabetss.
Creator: American Association for the Advancement of Science

Brief description: Database of handwritten digits.
Creator: National Institute of Standards and Technology

Dataset name: Optical Recognition of Handwritten Digits Dataset
Brief description: Normalized bitmaps of handwritten data.
Preprocessing: Size normalized and mapped to bitmaps.
Creator: E. Alpaydin et al.

Dataset name: Pen-Based Recognition of Handwritten Digits Dataset
Brief description: Handwritten digits on electronic pen-tablet.
Preprocessing: Feature vectors extracted to be uniformly spaced.
Creator: E. Alpaydin et al.

Brief description: Handwritten digits from 80 people.
Preprocessing: All handwritten digits have been normalized for size and mapped to the same grid.
Creator: T. Srl

Brief description: Handwritten mathematical symbols
Preprocessing: All symbols are centered and of size 32px x 32px.
Creator: Martin Thoma

Brief description: Includes Handwritten Numeral Dataset (10 classes) and Basic Character Dataset (50 classes)  each dataset has three types of noise: white gaussian  motion blur  and reduced contrast.
Preprocessing: All images are centered and of size 32x32.
